dataset_name: Renewable energy production will exacerbate mining threats to biodiversity
dataset_description: Mining density based on the number of known mining properties (pre-operational, operational, and closed) in a 50-cell radius (1x1 km cells).
dataset_authors: Sonter, L. J., Dade, M. C., Watson, J. E., & Valenta, R. K.
dataset_rest: Renewable energy production will exacerbate mining threats to biodiversity. Nature Communications, 11(1). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-020-17928-5

dataset_description: Number of significant hazards (earthquakes, volcanoes, landslides, floods, drought, cyclones) potentially affecting cells based on hazard frequency data.
dataset_authors: SEDAC
dataset_rest: Global Multihazard Frequency and Distribution, v1: Natural Disaster Hotspots. NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center. https://doi.org/10.7927/H45718Z5

dataset_description: Continuous metric of population density.
dataset_authors: Schiavina, M., Freire, S., & MacManus, K.
dataset_rest: GHS-pop R2019A - GHS population grid multitemporal (1975-1990-2000-2015). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC). https://doi.org/10.2905/42E8BE89-54FF-464E-BE7B-BF9E64DA5218

dataset_description: Percentage metric indicating the built-up presence.
dataset_authors: Corbane, C., Florczyk, A., Pesaresi, M., Politis, P. & Syrris, V.
dataset_rest: GHS built-up grid, derived from Landsat, multitemporal (1975-1990-2000-2014). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC). https://doi.org/10.2905/jrc-ghsl-10007

dataset_name: GRIP, Global Roads Inventory Project (Global patterns of current and future road infrastructure)
dataset_description: Continuous metric of road density.
dataset_authors: Meijer, J. R., Huijbregts, M. A. J., Schotten, K. C. G. J. and Schipper, A. M.
dataset_rest: Global patterns of current and future road infrastructure. Environmental Research Letters, 13(6), p.064006. https://doi.org/10.1088/1748-9326/aabd42

dataset_description: Percentage metric indicating anthropogenic impacts on the environment.
dataset_authors: SEDAC
dataset_rest: Global Human Footprint (Geographic), v2 (1995-2004): Last of the Wild. NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center. https://doi.org/10.7927/H4M61H5F

dataset_description: Classification of land into very low impact areas (1), low impact areas (2) and non-low impact areas (3) based on global data on human impacts including human population, livestock density, forest change, land cover and nighttime lights.
dataset_authors: Jacobson, A. P., Riggio, J., Tait, A. M. & Baillie, J. E. M.
dataset_rest: Global areas of low human impact ("Low Impact Areas") and fragmentation of the natural world. Dryad. https://doi.org/10.5061/dryad.z612jm67g

dataset_name: Managing the middle: A shift in conservation priorities based on the global human modification gradient
dataset_description: A continuous metric between 0 and 1 that reflects the proportion of a landscape that has been modified by collating remote sensing imagery and ground inventory data from 1980 to 2016 (with a median year of 2016) on a group of 5 anthropogenic stressors: 1) human settlement (population density & built‐up areas), 2) agriculture (cropland & livestock), 3) transportation (major roads, minor roads, two tracks (a kind of two direction dirt road created through pedestrian and vehicle passage) & railroads), 4) mining and energy production (mining, oil wells & wind turbines) and 5) electrical infrastructure (powerlines, nighttime lights).
dataset_authors: Kennedy, C. M., Oakleaf, J. R., Theobald, D. M., Baruch-Mordo, S., & Kiesecker, J.
dataset_rest: Managing the middle: A shift in conservation priorities based on the global human modification gradient. Global Change Biology, 25(3), 811-826. https://doi.org/10.1111/gcb.14549

dataset_name: Putting people in the map: anthropogenic biomes of the world
dataset_description: Classification of land cover into different anthropogenic biomes of differing pressure (0 to 5), wildlands (0), forested (1), rangeland (2), croplands (3), villages (4) and dense settlements (5).
dataset_authors: Ellis, E.C. & Ramankutty, N.
dataset_rest: Putting people in the map:  anthropogenic biomes of the world.  Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment, 6(8): 439-447. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1890/070062

dataset_description: Continuous metric of mean fire occurrence during the years of 2006 and 2016.
dataset_authors: Andela, N., Morton, D. C., Giglio, L., Paugam, R., Chen, Y., Hantson, S., van der Werf, G. R., & Randerson, J. T.
dataset_rest: The global fire atlas of individual fire size, duration, speed and direction. Earth System Science Data, 11(2), 529-552. https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-11-529-2019

dataset_name: A Unified Cropland Layer at 250 m for Global Agriculture Monitoring
dataset_description: Percentage metric indicating the proportion of cropland in each cell.
dataset_authors: Waldner, F., Fritz, S., Di Gregorio, A., Plotnikov, D., Bartalev, S., Kussul, N., Gong, P., Thenkabail, P., Hazeu, G., Klein, I., Low, F., Miettinen, J., Dadhwal, V. K., Lamarche, C., Bontemps, S., & Defourny, P.
dataset_rest: A unified cropland layer at 250 m for Global Agriculture Monitoring. Data, 1(1), 3. https://doi.org/10.3390/data1010003

dataset_name: IIASA-IFPRI Cropland (Mapping global cropland and field size)
dataset_description: Percentage metric indicating the proportion of cropland in each cell.
dataset_authors: Fritz, S., See, L., McCallum, I., You, L., Bun, A., Moltchanova, E., Duerauer, M., Albrecht, F., Schill, C., Perger, C., Havlik, P., Mosnier, A., Thornton, P., Wood?Sichra, U., Herrero, M., Becker?Reshef, I., Justice, C., Hansen, M., Gong, P., Abdel Aziz, S., Cipriani, A., Cumani, R., Cecchi, G., Conchedda, G., Ferreira, S., Gomez, A., Haffani, M., Kayitakire, F., Malanding, J., Mueller, R., Newby, T., Nonguierma, A., Olusegun, A., Ortner, S., Rajak, D. R., Rocha, J., Schepaschenko, D., Schepaschenko, M., Terekhov, A., Tiangwa, A., Vancutsem, C., Vintrou, E., Wenbin, W., van der Velde, M., Dunwoody, A., Kraxner, F. & Obersteiner, M.
dataset_rest: Mapping global cropland and field size. Global Change Biology, 21(5), pp.1980-1992. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1111/gcb.12838

dataset_name: Gridded Livestock of the World (Mapping the Global Distribution of Livestock)
dataset_description: Estimated total amount of livestock wet biomass based on global livestock head counts.
dataset_authors: Robinson, T. P., Wint, G. R. W., Conchedda, G., Van Boeckel, T. P., Ercoli, V., Palamara, E., Cinardi, G., D'Aietti, L., Hay, S. I., & Gilbert, M.
dataset_rest: Mapping the global distribution of Livestock. PLoS ONE, 9(5). https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0096084

dataset_name: New global forest/non-forest maps from ALOS PALSAR data (2007-2010)
dataset_description: Continuous -100 to 100 metric of forest tree cover loss between 2007 and 2017.
dataset_authors: Shimada, M., Itoh, T., Motooka, T., Watanabe, M., Shiraishi, T., Thapa, R., & Lucas, R.
dataset_rest: New Global Forest/non-forest maps from Alos Palsar data (2007-2010). Remote Sensing of Environment, 155, 13-31. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.rse.2014.04.014

dataset_description: Classification metric of 0 (no loss) or a discrete value from 1 to a potential maximum of 19, representing loss (a stand-replacement disturbance or change from a forest to non-forest state) detected primarily in the year 2001–2019, respectively.
dataset_authors: Global Forest Watch
dataset_rest: World Resources Institute.

dataset_description: Quantity of carbon needed to derive food and fiber products (HANPP).
dataset_authors: Imhoff, M. L., Bounoua, L., Ricketts, T., Loucks, C., Harriss, R. & Lawrence, W. T.
dataset_rest: Global Patterns of HANPP, v1 (1995). NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center.  https://doi.org/10.7927/H44Q7RWV

dataset_name: HANPP as a Percentage of Net Primary Productivity
dataset_description: HANNP as a percentage of local Net Primary Productivity.
dataset_authors: Imhoff, M. L., Bounoua, L., Ricketts, T., Loucks, C., Harriss, R. & Lawrence, W. T.
dataset_rest: HANPP as a Percentage of Net Primary Productivity, v1 (1995). NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center.  https://doi.org/10.7927/H44Q7RWV

dataset_name: Atlas of Artificial Night Sky Brightness
dataset_description: Continuous simulated zenith radiance data.
dataset_authors: Falchi, F., Cinzano, P., Duriscoe, D., Kyba, C. C. M., Elvidge, C. D., Baugh, K., Portnov, B. A., Rybnikova, N. A. & Furgoni, R.
dataset_rest: The new world atlas of artificial night sky brightness. Science Advances, 2(6). https://doi.org/10.1126/sciadv.1600377

dataset_description: Continuous metric of kilograms of fertilizer used per hectare.
dataset_authors: Potter, P., Ramankutty, N., Bennett., E. M. and Donner, S.D.
dataset_rest: Global Fertilizer and Manure, Version 1: Nitrogen Fertilizer Application. NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center. https://doi.org/10.7927/H4Q81B0R

dataset_description: Continuous metric of temperature trends, based on the linear regression coefficients of mean monthly temperature for the years of 1950 to 2019.
dataset_authors: Wan, Z., Hook, S., Hulley, G.
dataset_rest: MOD11C3 MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V006. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD11C3.006

dataset_description: Continuous metric of temperature trend significance, the temperature trends divided by its standard error.
dataset_authors: Wan, Z., Hook, S., Hulley, G.
dataset_rest: MOD11C3 MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V006. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD11C3.006

dataset_description: Continuous metric calculated as whatever is the largest of the absolute of the trend coefficients of the months with the lowest or highest mean temperatures.
dataset_authors: Abatzoglou, J. T., Dobrowski, S. Z., Parks, S. A. and Hegewisch, K. C.
dataset_rest: TerraClimate, a high-resolution global dataset of monthly climate and climatic water balance from 1958-2015. Scientific Data, 5. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2017.191

dataset_description: Continuous metric of the velocity of climate change, the ratio between TEMP_TRENDS and a local spatial gradient in mean temperature calculated as the slope of a plane fitted to the values of a 3x3 cell neighbourhood centered on each pixel.
dataset_authors: Wan, Z., Hook, S., Hulley, G.
dataset_rest: MOD11C3 MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature/Emissivity Monthly L3 Global 0.05Deg CMG V006. NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD11C3.006

dataset_description: Continuous metric of aridity trends, based on the linear regression coefficients of aridity for the years of 1990 to 2019, i.e: MPET/(MPRE+1).
dataset_authors: Abatzoglou, J. T., Dobrowski, S. Z., Parks, S. A. and Hegewisch, K. C.
dataset_rest: TerraClimate, a high-resolution global dataset of monthly climate and climatic water balance from 1958-2015. Scientific Data, 5. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2017.191
